title: 7 ways to play in Livermore this summer
text:
7 ways to play in Livermore this summer By Jackie Burrell Posted: 07/13/2015 12:00:00 PM PDT Updated: 07/13/2015 01:06:24 PM PDT The Wente Vineyards event center and tasting room is photographed in Livermore on May 5, 2015. (Doug Duran/Bay Area News Group) Summer fests Livermore Valley wineries are hosting an entire summer's worth of tapas parties, pizza fests and Wine Wednesdays. There are movies at dusk, concerts in the vineyards and even yoga on the lawn. Here's just a sampling to whet your appetite. 
Chouinard Winery: Enjoy concerts in the vineyards nearly every Sunday through August at this Palomares Canyon winery. The shows, which feature Dream Posse, Sugarbeats, the Von Trapps and more, run from 4:30 to 8:30 p.m. through August. On Saturdays in September, you can get your fright on with scary movies at dusk. First up: "It Came From Outer Space" on Sept. 5. Buy tickets ($45 per car for the concert series, $20 for the movies) and find details at www.chouinard.com . 
Las Positas: Pizza accompanies the tunes at this Livermore winery, where live bands perform two Fridays per month through October. Hear the James Nagel Band -- paired with prosciutto-provolone and spinach-provolone pizzas -- on July 24. Admission is $5, and personal pizzas are $10. Check out the rest of the schedule at www.laspositasvineyards.com . 
McGrail Vineyards: Yoga meets wine at McGrail, where a summerlong Yoga and Wine Sunset series (July 30 and Aug. 13) includes an hourlong yoga lesson on the lawn with sips and bites in the tasting room. Prefer to skip the presipping exercise? McGrail teams up with Livermore's Posada Catering for Tapas, Tasting and Tunes events on July 31 and Aug. 14, and a sunset concert series kicks off in September. Buy tickets ($30 for yoga, $10 for tapas and $25 for concerts) at www.mcgrailvineyards.com . Advertisement 
Retzlaff Vineyards: It may be too late to snag tickets for the July 19 Livermore Valley Opera in the Vineyard, but you can still catch Retzlaff's Comedy Uncorked series on Aug. 8 and Sept. 19. Chortle, sip and enjoy bites from local food trucks at this benefit for the Open Heart Kitchen. Tickets are $30 in advance, $35 at the door. www.retzlaffvineyards.com . 
3 Steves: On Aug. 14, "Wreck-It Ralph" meets cabernet at this winery's monthly pizza, wine and outdoor movie party. The movies are family-friendly and admission is free, but you'll need tickets to get in the gate. Find details at http://3steveswinery.com . 
Wente Vineyards: This iconic winery plays host to the Livermore Shakespeare Festival this summer, as well as its own outdoor concert series. Catch Lyle Lovett on July 21, Pat Benatar on July 28, Sheryl Crow on Aug. 3 and other major headliners. Concert tickets are $79 and up, concert and dining are $209 and up. 
Livermore Harvest Festival: Find details on Livermore Valley's large-scale events, from Taste Our Terroir on July 23-26, to the 34th annual Harvest Wine Celebration on Sept. 6, on the Livermore Valley Winegrowers Association's website, www.lvwine.org . The website makes it easy to plan a sipping itinerary, sort wineries by amenities (picnic facilities, dog friendliness) and browse events, including the association's Wine Wednesdays, when a rotating array of wineries stay open until 8 p.m. for the after-work crowd. -- Jackie Burrell, Staff
